document_data.name: Dakker
document_data.aliases: DakkarA possible misspelling, ''Dakkar'' is used multiple times but only on a single page of ''[[Volo's Guide to the Dalelands]]''.
document_data.mainbody: The '''Dakker''' family was an old, wealthy, and influential clan of [[Archendale]], which was still active during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities:
The clan operated a [[:Category:costers|trading coster]], the [[Darkwater Brand]], which dealt in ore, fresh products and [[Moonsea]] metalwork. Some of their side-businesses also included bodyguard services, as well as escorting precious cargo (such as captured creatures) and wealthy travelers. 

While the merchandises sold in their shop were pricey, they were usually of good quality.

However this was all a fa√ßade for much more [[evil|sinister]] endeavors: the family actually sold [[poison]] and nefarious [[potion]]s, and dealt in kidnapping, smuggling, and [[slavery]].
document_data.Tactics: The family employed lot of well-equipped [[mercenaries]] to watch over their unlawful activities. They explained the presence of those combatants, as well as their ownership of wagons fitted with cages and small siege weapons, by their side-businesses.
document_data.Base of Operations: The Darkwater Brand was active in [[Archenbridge]], [[Hillsfar]] and [[Ordulin]].
document_data.Relationships: The family had a bad reputation outside Archendale, and various rumors hinted at their criminal activities. In the Dale, they were careful not to break any laws, and were respected with a healthy dose of caution.
document_data.Rumors: According to some [[Arkhenfolk]], an invisible creature watched over the Archenbridge shop and hunted down would-be [[thieves]].
document_data.Members: * [[Vzoun Dakker]] was the Head of the family during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
